name: debugger-for-ios-web
description: Debug your JavaScript code running in Safari on iOS devices from VS Code.

deviceName.description: The name of the device to attach to (can be found at the proxy json endpoint) or '*' for any

diagnosticLogging.description: When true, the adapter logs its own diagnostic info to the console

port.description: Port to use for Chrome remote debugging.

proxyArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the proxy executable.

proxyExecutable.description: Workspace absolute path to the proxy executable to be used when attaching to a 'device'. If not specified, ios_webkit_debug_proxy.exe will be used from the default install location.

sourceMaps.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

url.description: A url to find in the attached browser

webRoot.description: This specifies the workspace absolute path to the webserver root.

deviceName.description: The name of the device to attach to (can be found at the proxy json endpoint) or '*' for any

diagnosticLogging.description: When true, the adapter logs its own diagnostic info to the console

port.description: Port to use for Chrome remote debugging.

proxyArgs.description: Optional arguments passed to the proxy executable.

proxyExecutable.description: Workspace absolute path to the proxy executable to be used when attaching to a 'device'. If not specified, ios_webkit_debug_proxy.exe will be used from the default install location.

sourceMaps.description: Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).

tunnelPort.description: The local port to expose from the local machine to the internet via a tunnel proxy (or '0' to disable). This allows the connected iOS device to access a webserver running on the local machine

url.description: A url to launch in the attached browser. If you are using the tunnelPort or startLocalServer settings, you can use a relative url here.

webRoot.description: This specifies the workspace absolute path to the webserver root.
